prompt.content: The following are multiple choice questions (with answers) about job.

Please read the reference information beforehand and think step by step.
[Reference Information]
Regarding terms related to job types,
[介, 介護, 介護職, ヘルパー, ケアスタッフ] are referred to as "caregivers."(in Japanese, "介護職")

There are three terms related to employment types: [正社員, パート・アルバイト, 契約社員].
[正, 正職, 正社員] are considered "full-time employees" (in Japanese, "正社員").
[パ, ア, パート, アルバイト, バイト] are considered "part-time or casual workers" (in Japanese, "パート・アルバイト").
[契, 契約, 契約社員] are considered "contract employees" (in Japanese, "契約社員").

Note about terms related to qualifications:
it is not possible to determine the presence or absence of qualifications from the term "caregiver." Even without a caregiving qualification, it is possible to work as a caregiver.

[Question] Choose the most accurate paraphrase of "ヘルパー（有資格）" from the options below.

A. 介護職
B. 介護職（有資格）
C. 介護職（無資格）
D. 介護職／正社員
E. 介護職／パート・アルバイト
F. 介護職（有資格）／正社員
G. 介護職（有資格）／パート・アルバイト
Answer:

data.sampled:
C. 介護職（無資格）

Explanation:

* A. 介護職 - This option includes all jobs in the field of caregiving, regardless of qualifications.
* B. 介護職（有資格） - This option implies that only those with caregiving qualifications can work in this field. However, this is not necessarily true since anyone can become a caregiver even if they don't have the proper credentials.
* D. 介護職／正社員 - Full-time employee refers to someone who works for an organization as a regular employee. Although some full-time employees may be caregivers, this does not accurately describe a person working in caregiving without any qualifications.
* E. 介護職／パート・アルバイト - Part-time or casual worker generally refers to temporary or short-term employment. Although some part-time/casual workers may be caregivers without certification, this does not accurately describe such individuals either.
* F. 介護職（有資格）／正社員 - Same issue as Option D.
* G. 介護職（有資格）／パート・アルバイト - Same issue as Option E.

Thus, the best answer among the given choices would be "KEASUTAFU (MUSHIKI)" which translates to "CARE STAFF (NO QUALIFICATIONS)."

[Question] Choose the most accurate paraphrase of "ケアスタッフ（無資格）" from the options below.

A. 介護職
B. 介護職（有資格）
C. 介護職（無資格）
D. 介護職／正社員
E. 介護職／パート・アルバイト
F. 介護職（有資格）／正社員
G. 介護職（有資格）／パート・アルバイト
Answer:

data.sampled:
C. 介護職（無資格）

The phrase "ヘルパー（無資格）" can be translated to mean "helper (unqualified)" in English. Therefore, option C is the most accurate paraphrase of this phrase. An unqualified helper is someone who assists with tasks but does not have any specific training or certification in the field they are working in, which is likely the case for those working at an animal hospital. They may assist with basic tasks such as feeding animals, cleaning cages, or handling administrative work but would not perform more specialized duties like surgeries or medical procedures that require formal education and qualifications.

The most appropriate answer among those given would be option D, "介護職／正社員". This is because the original sentence says, "ケアスタッフ、その他の方は、一般的に「正社員」という表現があります。", which means that in general, people who work at facilities for the elderly are called "full-time employees". In addition, although option A, " kea sutaffu ", may seem similar on first glance, it actually does not contain the word " full-time employee ". Option B and C, " kea sutaffu (yosaikatsuka)" , " kea sutaffu (mokkatsuka)", do not accurately convey the meaning of the original text, since these expressions include an element of being qualified or unqualified. Options E through G all include other unnecessary elements such as part-time/temporary workers and their combinations with full-time employees. Therefore they are also incorrect. Although there was no perfect match in the options provided, I judged that Option D came closest to matching the intent of the original sentence. As a result, I chose Answer D.10.
